settings.custom_liquid:
FOR LOVERS OF JAPANESE TEAS

We offer a selection of the finest Japanese teas that pair perfectly with the content of your gift box.

GOURMET FOODS

Each gift box contains gourmet foods from some of Kyoto's oldest and finest producers.

LIFESTYLE GOODS

We bring you exquisitely crafted Japanese lifestyle goods designed to complement your home and office.

BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED

Each month's selection comes in a hand-made and beautifully presented gift box exclusive to Mizu Japan customers.

settings.description:
Product of: Kyoto
Produced by: Shunzan-gama

Shunzan-gama is a third generation pottery maker who's techniques and methods of pottery date back to Ogata Kenzan (1663~1743) who was one of the greatest Japanese ceramicists. These delightful handmade sake cups are adorned with exquisite Japanese motifs. They are not only practical but are so eye catching they can simply be displayed to brighten up any room you choose to place them in.

*Important Note* Each cup is uniquely crafted and as such the pattern, color, and size, will differ from those displayed in the photos. Thank you for your understanding.

Product of: Kyoto
Produced by: Yamadamatsu

This unique incense set comes with a porcelain square with a small hole set in a corner in which to place the incense stick itself.
The holder has a beautiful traditional floral design which matches the box that contains the incense sticks themselves.
The incense gives off a graceful and elegant fragrance, inspired by plum blossoms, which will put you at ease while you enjoy the contents of your gift box.
As the incense holder and sticks comes in a set that beautifully complement each other it also makes and ideal gift for a friend or loved one.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes/No
Common Allergen(s): Wheat, Milk, Soy
Produced by: Kyoto Marun

A modern culinary take on a Japanese tradition.
These chocolate cookies each have a unique and adorable kimono pattern on them and will surprise and delight you with how adorable they are!
The chocolate cookies are baked to perfection with white chocolate kneaded into them so that they have a slightly crumbly texture.
Thoughtfully presented in packets of 3 in a delightful wooden box they make a uniquely charming gift and perfectly complement our December gift box content.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): Soy
Produced by: Sasayaiori

A veritable treat awaits the recipients of this month's gift box with these delightful treats as we offer you two of the most delectable types of Japanese rice cake (mochi).
The two flavors being 'kinako', roasted soybean flour, and the other being 'yuzu', Japanese citrus fruit.
The kinako mochi is accompanied by black sugar syrup to drizzle over it.
These delicate treats are prepared by a company dating back to 1716 when the confectionery maker Sasaya Ihee was summoned to Kyoto by the Imperial Palace to produce confectionary exclusively for it and select tea grandmasters, temples, and shrines.
The quality of its produce remains as high today as it was over three hundred years ago.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: No
Common Allergen(s): Milk, Soy
Produced by: Toshoan

This delicious and innovative spread is a delightful blend of anko (red bean paste) and butter.
The fragrant aroma of toasted bread and the buttery aroma of red bean paste combine to create an alluring aroma that will whet your appetite.
The anko paste has a nice sweetness to it, but it's not too sweet! The pleasant saltiness of butter is well-balanced and irresistible.
Spread it on toast in the morning or ice cream in the evening to give yourself a special treat.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): Soy
Produced by: Toshoan

Yokan is a jelly like confection made from sweet bean paste and a classic example of Japanese confectionery. It is a well-known type of sweet in Japan with various types of seasonal yokan found throughout the country. In this month's gift box is an offering of delicious coffee flavored yokan which is a firm favorite amongst Japanese people. It's ideal when paired with a cup of coffee complementing one another's flavor.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): None
Produced by: Kitchoan

Yuzu is a traditional Japanese citrus fruit that has long been used in Japanese cuisine.
Yuzu is used to make various sweets such as the one we offer this month.
Tokoyo Yuzu uses the fruits rind dipped in moist honey giving it a unique bittersweet flavor.
A delicious treat that you'll find difficult to stop tasting!

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Savory
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes/No
Common Allergen(s): Soy
Produced by: Tsujigahana

Ochazuke is a simple and healthy dish of steamed rice with an assortment of savory ingredients, partially steeped in green tea.
Ocha refers to green tea, and zuke means 'submerged'. Daikon means radish which is the main flavor of the many toppings of the ochazuke we offer this month.
Ochazuke became popular in Japan's Heian period when water was commonly poured over the rice, however since the Edo period, green tea is often used instead.
Though simple, ochazuke is a wholesome and comforting food that is especially delicious during the winter months. It's the Japanese equivalent of comfort food bringing back fond memories of long winter evenings at home.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): None
Produced by: Kyojyurakuan

Houjicha is a specially prepared Japanese green tea and houjicha candy is as special as the tea it is made from.
These sweet little crunchy candies have the subtle taste of houjicha and are a perfect non-filling treat. They can be enjoyed on their own, with tea (houjicha is, of course, recommended) and even mixed in with vanilla ice cream for a delightful crunchy treat. They're as delicious as they are versatile.

Product of: Tokyo
Flavor: Sweet
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): Wheat, Milk, Soy, Sesame
Produced by: Azabu Karinto

Karinto is a traditional Japanese snack food. Sweet and deep-fried, it is made primarily of flour, yeast, and brown sugar.
Zarame Karinto has the special added ingredient of 'zarame' which is a coarse brown sugar coating the treat. Its color comes from a special process where caramel is added giving it a richer flavor. Karinto comes in many varieties with 'zazame' being one of the most popular. You're guaranteed to enjoy its subtle sweetness as many generations of Japanese have.
Pairing suggestion: We recommend pairing with the Uji Sencha Tea which also accompanies this month's selection.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: Matcha (green tea)
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): None
Produced by: Ippodo

All the goodness of matcha tea delivered in a convenient single-serve packet.
Produced by one of Japan's foremost tea companies it has a well-balanced taste without any bitterness and goes well with all sweets.
Enjoy the very finest matcha tea with convenience wherever you find yourself.

Product of: Kyoto
Flavor: N/A
Suitable for vegetarians: Yes
Common Allergen(s): None
Produced by: Fukujuen

Founded in 1790, Fukujuen is one of Japan's foremost tea producers.
We are delighted to provide you with their famous sencha tea from the Uji, Kyoto in this month's gift box.
Sencha is steamed green tea made from the Camellia Sinensis tea bushes. The leaves are picked by hand from areas with direct sunlight and are then steamed and to exposes enzymes to the air, speeding up the process of oxidation.
Sensha has soft grassy notes, at times reminiscent of rice. Fresh and clear flavor it is a delightful refreshment making it very popular with Japanese people.
